events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred at the intersection resulting in damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim has been categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to involvement of a car and collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and contact the claimant for further details.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the insurance company and the customer was informed about the next steps.
Requested the customer to submit accident photos, police report, and vehicle repair estimates for processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the damaged vehicle and official police report.
Investigation team assigned to verify accident details and assess vehicle damage for claim validation.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the vehicle collision circumstances align with the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the damage assessment and policy coverage limits.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested timely payment to repair the vehicle.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriter after reviewing all investigation results and customer feedback.
Payment was issued promptly to the vehicle ownerâ€™s designated account to cover repair costs.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed following payment and customer confirmation of receipt.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
